formattedAddress: 116 E 66th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 116 E 66th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: Dr. Loiselle has been my children’s pediatrician for the past 16 years. She is absolutely amazing, caring, knowledgeable, available, and smart. Her staff are also amazing and they always go above and beyond to help. We are very lucky to have found this practice. We highly recommend this practice.

text.text: Dr. Loiselle has been my children’s pediatrician for the past 16 years. She is absolutely amazing, caring, knowledgeable, available, and smart. Her staff are also amazing and they always go above and beyond to help. We are very lucky to have found this practice. We highly recommend this practice.

originalText.text: Dr. Loiselle is our family pediatrician for the past 18 years. The dedication, attention and kindness that she has shown to our children is remarkable. There really is no other pediatrician like her. Her partner Dr. Popper is very nice and we have always had a great experience at the office.

text.text: Dr. Loiselle is our family pediatrician for the past 18 years. The dedication, attention and kindness that she has shown to our children is remarkable. There really is no other pediatrician like her. Her partner Dr. Popper is very nice and we have always had a great experience at the office.

originalText.text: So thankful that we have an amazing Pediatrician; Suzanne Loiselle is consistently informative, always educates us as parents and explains her rationale. She thinks beyond the status quo, challenges assumptions and follows her instincts as a doctor leaving no stone unturned. She is so informative and explains things very clearing to us as parents. Despite being jammed with patients; she always makes Charlotte seem like the only baby in the world that she's 110% focused on! So blessed that C is in such care and her support staff are amazing too!

text.text: So thankful that we have an amazing Pediatrician; Suzanne Loiselle is consistently informative, always educates us as parents and explains her rationale. She thinks beyond the status quo, challenges assumptions and follows her instincts as a doctor leaving no stone unturned. She is so informative and explains things very clearing to us as parents. Despite being jammed with patients; she always makes Charlotte seem like the only baby in the world that she's 110% focused on! So blessed that C is in such care and her support staff are amazing too!

originalText.text: Dr. Loiselle is a great doctor!  Friendly staff, efficient, timely, and we never feel rushed!  We love her and use her for both of our children!  We would recommend her to anyone looking for a pediatrician.

text.text: Dr. Loiselle is a great doctor!  Friendly staff, efficient, timely, and we never feel rushed!  We love her and use her for both of our children!  We would recommend her to anyone looking for a pediatrician.

originalText.text:
Score is misleading given the practice has 2 docs with different views/approaches and you don't see one doctor exclusively. Was surprised about the lack of interest and sympathy from Dr. Popper. Doctors should share goals and information about patients. When we met Dr. P, first words were "you need to give baby formula", without getting to know our preference or explaining their rational - this put enormous stress on mom. When we started to ask reasoning and explain why we felt we were doing everything as expected, doctor got defensive. We were asked to leave the practice after 1 visit with Dr. P.
We only learned about our baby's weight percentile in the final notice. Doctor we switched to shows data to back up recommendations (and weight has never been an issue and less stress).
If you are a new parent and need data to rationalize decisions, this may not be a fit. Also were recommended to come in every 2-3 days to check weight and were charged a visit fee every time just for weighting a baby.
